title: [K-12] Mathematical Modeling for Environmental Problem-Solving: An Interdisciplinary Approach

context.prior_knowledge: High school-level mathematics proficiency (calculus, statistics, functions)
context.additional_context: Parallel online learning via digital devices and offline workshops, focusing on environmental data analysis and modeling

learning_goals: Learners can mathematically analyze environmental data (carbon emissions, renewable energy production, etc.) to explain trends and patterns.
Learners can construct a carbon concentration change model using differential equations and present predictable scenarios.
Learners can quantitatively evaluate and visualize the effectiveness of environmental policies using statistical tools.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
